section_id: ## Section 2: Cloning Operator LSI (Mean-Field Generator Analysis)

hints.title: Mean-Field Cloning Contraction
hints.content:
4534: :label: lem-cloning-contraction-standalone
4535: 
4536: Under Hypotheses 1-4, for infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
4537: 
4538: $$
4539: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
4540: $$
4541: 
4542: where:
4543: $$
4544: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
4545: $$
4546: 
4547: and:
4548: $$
4549: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
4550: $$
4551:
hints.section: ## Section 2: Cloning Operator LSI (Mean-Field Generator Analysis)
hints.raw_directive:
4531: ### 2.3. Main Lemma
4532: 
4533: :::{prf:lemma} Mean-Field Cloning Contraction
4534: :label: lem-cloning-contraction-standalone
4535: 
4536: Under Hypotheses 1-4, for infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
4537: 
4538: $$
4539: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
4540: $$
4541: 
4542: where:
4543: $$
4544: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
4545: $$
4546: 
4547: and:
4548: $$
4549: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
4550: $$
4551: 
4552: for $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$.

hints.label: proof-cloning-contraction-standalone
hints.content:
4557: :label: proof-cloning-contraction-standalone
4558: 
4559: We use entropy-potential decomposition:
4560: 
4561: $$
4562: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) = -H(\mu) + E_\mu[\pi] = -H(\mu) + \int \rho_\mu V_{\text{QSD}}
4563: $$
4564: 
4565: **Part A: Potential Energy Reduction**
4566: 
4567: **A.1**: The infinitesimal change is:
4568: 
4569: $$
4570: E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi] = \tau \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) V_{\text{QSD}}(z) \, dz + O(\tau^2)
4571: $$
4572: 
4573: **A.2**: Substituting the generator:
4574: 
4575: $$
4576: I := \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) V_{\text{QSD}}(z) \, dz = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega \times \Omega} \rho_\mu(z_d) \rho_\mu(z_c) P_{\text{clone}}(V_d, V_c) \Delta V \, dz_d dz_c
4577: $$
4578: 
4579: where $\Delta V = V_{\text{QSD}}(z_c) - V_{\text{QSD}}(z_d)$.
4580: 
4581: **A.3**: **Key technique - Permutation symmetry**.
4582: 
4583: The system is invariant under permutations of particles (exchangeability). This means the integral $I$ is symmetric under swapping $z_d \leftrightarrow z_c$.
4584: 
4585: **Symmetrization**: Write $I$ two ways:
4586: 
4587: 1. Original: $I = \int \rho_d \rho_c P(V_d, V_c) \Delta V$
4588: 2. Swapped: $I = \int \rho_c \rho_d P(V_c, V_d) (-\Delta V)$
4589: 
4590: Average them:
4591: 
4592: $$
4593: 2I = \int \rho_d \rho_c [P(V_d, V_c) \Delta V - P(V_c, V_d) \Delta V]
4594: $$
4595: 
4596: For $P_{\text{clone}} = \lambda_{\text{clone}} V_c/V_d$ (on $\Omega_1$ where $V_c < V_d$):
4597: 
4598: $$
4599: P(V_d, V_c) - P(V_c, V_d) = \lambda_{\text{clone}}(V_c/V_d - V_d/V_c)
4600: $$
4601: 
4602: Using $V_c/V_d = e^{-\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V}$ (fitness-QSD anti-correlation):
4603: 
4604: $$
4605: \frac{V_c}{V_d} - \frac{V_d}{V_c} = e^{-\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} - e^{\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} = -2\sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V)
4606: $$
4607: 
4608: Therefore:
4609: 
4610: $$
4611: I = -\frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c \Delta V \sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V) \, dz_d dz_c
4612: $$
4613: 
4614: **A.4**: **Sinh inequality**.
4615: 
4616: Since $\sinh(z)/z = 1 + z^2/6 + \cdots \geq 1$ for all $z$:
4617: 
4618: $$
4619: \Delta V \sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V) = \lambda_{\text{corr}} (\Delta V)^2 \frac{\sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V)}{\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} \geq \lambda_{\text{corr}} (\Delta V)^2
4620: $$
4621: 
4622: Thus:
4623: 
4624: $$
4625: I \leq -\frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}} \lambda_{\text{corr}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c (\Delta V)^2 \, dz_d dz_c
4626: $$
4627: 
4628: **A.5**: **Variance bound**.
4629: 
4630: The integral is related to variance:
4631: 
4632: $$
4633: \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c (\Delta V)^2 \, dz_d dz_c \geq c_1 \cdot \text{Var}_\mu[V_{\text{QSD}}]
4634: $$
4635: 
4636: **A.6**: **Poincaré inequality**.
4637: 
4638: For log-concave $\pi$ with density $\rho_\pi = e^{-V_{\text{QSD}}}$:
4639: 
4640: $$
4641: \text{Var}_\mu[V_{\text{QSD}}] \geq \lambda_{\text{Poin}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)
4642: $$
4643: 
4644: This is a standard functional inequality for log-concave measures (Bakry-Émery).
4645: 
4646: **A.7**: **Combine**:
4647: 
4648: $$
4649: E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi] \leq -\tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + O(\tau^2)
4650: $$
4651: 
4652: where:
4653: $$
4654: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
4655: $$
4656: 
4657: **Part B: Entropy Change**
4658: 
4659: **B.1**: The infinitesimal entropy change is:
4660: 
4661: $$
4662: H(\mu) - H(\mu') = -\tau \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz + O(\tau^2)
4663: $$
4664: 
4665: **B.2**: Decompose into sink and source:
4666: 
4667: $$
4668: = -\tau \int S_{\text{src}}[\rho_\mu] [\log \rho_\mu + 1] + \tau \int S_{\text{sink}}[\rho_\mu] [\log \rho_\mu + 1] + O(\tau^2)
4669: $$
4670: 
4671: **B.3**: **Sink term** (selection):
4672: 
4673: $$
4674: \int S_{\text{sink}}[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz = \int \rho_\mu(z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \bar{P}(z) \, dz
4675: $$
4676: 
4677: where $\bar{P}(z) = \frac{1}{m_a} \int P_{\text{clone}}(V[z], V[z']) \rho_\mu(z') dz' \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}}$.
4678: 
4679: Bound:
4680: 
4681: $$
4682: \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}} \int \rho_\mu [\log \rho_\mu + 1] = -\lambda_{\text{clone}} H(\mu) + \lambda_{\text{clone}}
4683: $$
4684: 
4685: Using $H(\mu) \geq -\log \rho_{\max}$:
4686: 
4687: $$
4688: \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}} \log \rho_{\max} + \lambda_{\text{clone}}
4689: $$
4690: 
4691: **B.4**: **Source term** (offspring with Gaussian noise).
4692: 
4693: This is the cross-entropy term:
4694: 
4695: $$
4696: J := -\int S_{\text{src}}[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz
4697: $$
4698: 
4699: Rewrite as:
4700: 
4701: $$
4702: J = M \cdot H(\rho_{\text{offspring}}) - M \cdot D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{offspring}} \| \rho_\mu) - M
4703: $$
4704: 
4705: where $\rho_{\text{offspring}}(z)$ is the density of offspring after Gaussian noise.
4706: 
4707: **B.4.1**: **Shannon's Entropy Power Inequality**.
4708: 
4709: For Gaussian convolution $\rho_{\text{offspring}} = \rho_{\text{clone}} * G_{\delta^2}$:
4710: 
4711: $$
4712: H(\rho_{\text{offspring}}) \geq H(\rho_{\text{clone}}) + \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)
4713: $$
4714: 
4715: **B.4.2**: **De Bruijn's identity for KL divergence**.
4716: 
4717: Treat Gaussian noise as heat flow: $\rho_t = \rho_{\text{clone}} * G_t$ for $t \in [0, \delta^2]$.
4718: 
4719: De Bruijn (1959):
4720: 
4721: $$
4722: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu) = -\frac{1}{2} I(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu)
4723: $$
4724: 
4725: where $I(p \| q) = \int p |\nabla \log(p/q)|^2$ is relative Fisher information.
4726: 
4727: **B.4.3**: **Log-Sobolev Inequality**.
4728: 
4729: For log-concave $\pi$ (Hypothesis 1), there exists $\kappa > 0$ such that:
4730: 
4731: $$
4732: I(p \| \rho_\mu) \geq 2\kappa D_{\text{KL}}(p \| \rho_\mu)
4733: $$
4734: 
4735: This is the **Bakry-Émery LSI** for log-concave measures.
4736: 
4737: **B.4.4**: **Exponential contraction**.
4738: 
4739: Combining de Bruijn and LSI:
4740: 
4741: $$
4742: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu) \leq -\kappa D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu)
4743: $$
4744: 
4745: Integrating (Grönwall):
4746: 
4747: $$
4748: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\delta^2} \| \rho_\mu) \leq e^{-\kappa \delta^2} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\mu)
4749: $$
4750: 
4751: i.e.,
4752: 
4753: $$
4754: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{offspring}} \| \rho_\mu) \leq e^{-\kappa \delta^2} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{clone}} \| \rho_\mu)
4755: $$
4756: 
4757: **B.5**: **Combined entropy bound**.
4758: 
4759: Combining sink and source:
4760: 
4761: $$
4762: H(\mu) - H(\mu') \leq C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
4763: $$
4764: 
4765: where:
4766: 
4767: $$
4768: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right]
4769: $$
4770: 
4771: For $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2 := \frac{1}{2\pi e} \exp(2\log(\rho_{\max}/\rho_{\min})/d)$, we have $C_{\text{ent}} < 0$.
4772: 
4773: **Part C: Combine**
4774: 
4775: $$
4776: \begin{aligned}
4777: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) &= -H(\mu') + E_{\mu'}[\pi] \\
4778: &= -[H(\mu) - (H(\mu) - H(\mu'))] + [E_\mu[\pi] + (E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi])] \\
4779: &\leq -H(\mu) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + E_\mu[\pi] - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + O(\tau^2) \\
4780: &= D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
4781: \end{aligned}
4782: $$
4783:
